Context:
The Text Learning Center (TLC) at Georgian College offers tutoring services for students in-person and online. They provide support for English and Math, and offer workshops on various academic skills. The TLC also welcomes faculty referrals for students who may be interested in becoming tutors. For more information, contact the TLC Advisor at your campus.

Colleges: Georgian College

Services Offered: Tutoring (English and Math), Workshops (academic skills)

Contact Information: Contact Us (for specific campus contacts)

Website: N/A

Location: Multiple campuses

Referral Forms: English Referral Form, Math Referral Form.

Hiring Process: Faculty recommendations are taken into consideration but do not guarantee hiring. For more information on the hiring process, visit How to Become a Tutor.

Campaigns and Initiatives: Classroom visits, Workshops for faculty request, Promotional posters available for faculty.

Years of Operation: N/A

Number of Students Served: N/A

Email Contacts: N/A (for specific campus contacts, visit Contact Us)

George Brown College offers a variety of programs and services, including education and land acknowledgment. They encourage staying updated with application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more by signing up for their information emails or visiting their social media hub. The main number to contact the college is 416-415-2000 (TTY: 1-877-515-5559), and they can be reached via email at ask.george@georgebrown.ca. Their website is https://www.georgebrown.ca/ and their social media hub can be visited by clicking "Visit Our Social Media Hub" [link to the hub]. The college has been operating for over 50 years, as evidenced in their land acknowledgment statement.
